item.title: about me
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: Hi, I'm Zach! I love leveraging machine learning to solve challenging problems in neuroscience, in computer vision, and with hardware. I’m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL at Vanderbilt University investigating applied ML to medical and neuroscientific data – mainly brain MRI for neurological diseases and endoscopic video feeds for nephrolithotomy. Generally, my interests are generative learning & dimensionality reduction, cyberphysical systems & robotics, and optimization & control theory. Check out my projects to see what I’m working on! GitHub LinkedIn Goodreads
item.content:encoded: Hi, I'm Zach! I love leveraging machine learning to solve challenging problems in neuroscience, in computer vision, and with hardware. I&rsquo;m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL at Vanderbilt University investigating applied ML to medical and neuroscientific data &ndash; mainly brain MRI for neurological diseases and endoscopic video feeds for nephrolithotomy. Generally, my interests are generative learning &amp; dimensionality reduction, cyberphysical systems &amp; robotics, and optimization &amp; control theory. Check out my projects to see what I&rsquo;m working on! GitHub LinkedIn Goodreads I graduated from Vandy in May 2021 with a B.S. in computer science and neuroscience, minoring in applied math. I expect to complete my masters in computer science from Vandy in May 2022. During undergrad, I was a mentor in the VUSE Design Studio. I have had the privilege to assist with courses on discrete structures, operating systems, and deep learning. Outside of research, I enjoy heavy weights, friendship, haiku &amp; senryu, hendiadys, esports, kombucha, cucumber cocktails, and sunset runs. Occasionally, I take a good photo and write a haiku or senryu to pair with it. I am a Lusophone &gt; Hispanophone &gt; Francophone. I self-studied Portuguese throughout high school, then I took a crucial gap year of emotional and linguistic growth in Lisbon, Portugal. My hometown is Austin, TX. I am always open to new opportunities, especially those that align with my interests. You can contact me at zachary.a.stoebner@vanderbilt.edu.

item.title: notes intro & intentions
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: Catiator: A Gladiator meme ... but different Welcome! To inaugurate my notes, here are my intentions: To collect and structure what I learn and ideate. To hopefully help and entertain weary travelers and passersby.
